result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case Called: 8:24 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person. Defendant appears from MCJ in person, with Atty Natasha VanLieshout.
Date and time set for bond modification hearing.
VRCW. 

COURT has reviewed motion for bond modification and spoke with the responsible Court official prior to this hearing.
Atty VanLieshout indicates the parties have an agreement to modify the bond to a signature bond, and if the modification is granted the Deft will withdraw his speedy trial demand.
ADA Vechinski in agreement.
COURT modifies bond to a $3,000.00 signature bond, same conditions as previously ordered; Deft must update court within 48 hours if he changes his address.
Atty VanLieshout moves to withdraw speedy trial demand.
Defendant in agreement.
COURT grants motion to withdraw speedy demand. 
Atty VanLieshout to file order, COURT to adopt.

Dates to remain.
